name: file_write
description: Create or overwrite a file on the local filesystem with the provided content. The content must be base64-encoded before writing.

file_name.description: Full absolute path where the file should be written (e.g., '/home/user/documents/file.txt', '/tmp/data.json'). Use forward slashes for path separators.

file_data.description: The file content encoded as a base64 string. To write text, first encode it to base64. To write binary data, provide the base64 representation of the binary content.

name: file_find
description: Search for files by name in the filesystem. This will recursively search from the current directory or system-wide depending on implementation.

file_name.description: Name of the file to search for. Can be exact filename (e.g., 'config.json') or pattern with wildcards (e.g., '*.txt', 'test*'). Do not include path, just the filename.

search_path.description: Optional: Directory path to start the search from. If not provided, searches from current working directory. Use absolute paths for best results.

name: file_read
description: Read the contents of a file from the local filesystem. Returns the file content, typically as text or base64-encoded for binary files.

file_path.description: Full absolute path to the file to read (e.g., '/home/user/documents/file.txt', '/etc/config.conf'). File must exist and be readable.

name: file_list
description: List all files and subdirectories in a specified directory. Returns file names, sizes, permissions, and modification dates.

directory.description: Full path to the directory to list (e.g., '/home/user/', '/tmp/', './'). If not provided, lists the current working directory. Use '.' for current directory or '..' for parent directory.

show_hidden.description: Whether to include hidden files (files starting with '.') in the listing. Defaults to false.

recursive.description: Whether to recursively list files in subdirectories. Defaults to false (only immediate directory contents).
